column1: Art Institute of Chicago////I was far too involved with taking yet another look at the Japanese woodblock prints so I have to regret spending too little time viewing the Jasper Johns Gray show. It offers a broad and inclusive look at the his ideas and paintings. It's great being able to compare manipulation of medium
column3: as viewers able to see the various incarnations of ideas. Can't wait to see it again (and spend too little time viewing yet another spectacular show!)
